entry.title: Elastomer lattices
entry.content:
The project that I spent several months to finish in late 2015 at the USC. In order to evaluate the material properties of the architected metamaterials with different lattice structures, they are designed in Solidworks and fabricated by a 3D printer.

A research paper is published based on this. Reference: Highly-stretchable 3D-architected mechanical metamaterials

entry.title: A hierarchical elastomer lattice
entry.content:
The pictures below were taken in Apr. 2016 when I was pursuing a PhD at the University of Southern California. It can be appreciated purely from a aesthetical perspective without any rational pursuit.

A research paper is published based on this. Reference: Stretchable 3D lattice conductors

entry.title: Ferromagnetic elastomer lattices
entry.content:
A ferromagnetic elastomer octet-truss lattice is deformed subject to a magnetic field. This is one of my favorite research projects during the time I was studying at the USC.

A theoretical analysis on the phenomena is given as following: 'Magnetic Field controlled Buckling and Postbuckling of an Inclined Beam'

I left the USC in July 2017. Unfortunately, I did not have time to finish the rest of this research project and many others.

Anyway, an excellent work based on the ferromagnetic elasomers is finally done by the successors. Reference: Magnetoactive acoustic metamaterials (Big congrats!)

entry.title: Permeability for fluid structural interaction
entry.content: An Octet-truss structure is designed as an representative volume element in a two-scale fluid structural interaction analysis, where the inverse domain is meshed for the fluid field.

entry.title: Thin film buckling
entry.content:
A Film-substrate system is subject to compression, where the film is attached to a soft substrate with complex architecture:

Buckling modes under different stiffness ratio between the substrate and the thin film:
